Description: Pottery krater with two upturned horizontal handles with rotelles; reconstructed from numerous sherds; rim, handles and upper body survive, base and lower body are modern plaster reconstructions; undecorated with smoothed surface; votive graffito on rim.
Curator's comments: According to a note in the British Museum registers, the krater was found in the bottom of the sand in the temenos of Apollo; however this may be a mix-up with the Polemarchos krater.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 18, O.1, pl. IV, no. 1)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 642, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.358)
